member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.LibraryHomePage
member.summary: URL for the home page of this library in case it is found somewhere without its supporting documentation.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.DnsClient.LookupHost(System.String)
member.summary: Lookup the IP address(es) for a host.
member.param: The host name to look up. IDNs may be either in native or encoded form (xn--...).

remarks.para: This overload queries the DNS servers found in the local computer's IP configuration using default DNS request options (see remarks in properties of the object).

member.exception: Invalid host name.
No DNS servers where specified, and no DNS servers could be found in this computer's IP configuration
The requested domain name does not exist (DNS server returned RCode 3 NXDomain).
The requested domain name exists but has no records of the requested type.
None of the DNS servers returned a definitive answer.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.DnsClient.LookupHost(System.String,JHSoftware.DnsClient.IPVersion)
member.summary: Lookup the IP address(es) for a host.
member.param: The host name to look up. IDNs may be either in native or encoded form (xn--...).
The IP version (IPv4 / IPv6) of the IP addresses to return.

remarks.para: This overload queries the DNS servers found in the local computer's IP configuration using default DNS request options (see remarks in properties of the object).

member.exception: Invalid host name or IP version.
No DNS servers where specified, and no DNS servers could be found in this computer's IP configuration
The requested domain name does not exist (DNS server returned RCode 3 NXDomain).
The requested domain name exists but has no records of the requested type.
None of the DNS servers returned a definitive answer.

member.summary: Lookup the IP address(es) for a host.
member.param: The host name to look up. IDNs may be either in native or encoded form (xn--...).
The IP version (IPv4 / IPv6) of the IP addresses to return.
The options to use with the DNS request.
member.exception: Invalid host name or IP version.
No DNS servers where specified, and no DNS servers could be found in this computer's IP configuration
The requested domain name does not exist (DNS server returned RCode 3 NXDomain).
The requested domain name exists but has no records of the requested type.
None of the DNS servers returned a definitive answer.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.DnsClient.BeginLookupHost(System.String,JHSoftware.DnsClient.IPVersion,JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins to asynchronously lookup the IP address(es) for a host.
member.param: The host name to look up. IDNs may be either in native or encoded form (xn--...).
The IP version (IPv4 / IPv6) of the IP addresses to return.
The options to use with the DNS request. Specify null/Nothing for default options.
The AsyncCallback delegate.
An object that contains state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

No DNS servers where specified, and no DNS servers could be found in this computer's IP configuration

member.name: M:JHSoftware.DnsClient.EndLookupHost(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous lookup of the IP address(es) for a host
member.param: An IAsyncResult that stores state information and any user defined data for this asynchronous operation.
member.exception: The requested domain name does not exist (DNS server returned RCode 3 NXDomain).
The requested domain name exists but has no records of the requested type.
None of the DNS servers returned a definitive answer.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.MXHost.HostName
member.summary: Host name of a mail exchanger (SMTP server)

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.MXHost.Preference
member.summary: Preference value of a mail exchanger (SMTP server) in relation to other MXHost items

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.MXHost.IPAddresses
member.summary: IP address(es) of mail exchanger (SMTP server) if provided by DNS server, otherwise null/Nothing.
member.remarks: Note that the DNS server may or may not provide these IP addresses. This is optional for the DNS server to do and typically depends on the data being available/cached at the time of the request. If the DNS server did not provide any IP addresses (the value of this property is null/Nothing), you can use the function on the value to obtain the IP address(es).

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.MXHost
member.summary: Represents a mail exhcanger's (SMTP server) host name, preference (in relation to other MXHosts), and IP addresses (if provided by DNS server).

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.DnsServers
member.summary: IP addresses of the DNS servers to query.

remarks.para: Default value: null/Nothing
The DNS servers specified will be queried in the order listed.
When this is null/Nothing (default), the DNS servers from the local computer's IP configuration will be used.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.ToPort
member.summary: The UDP/TCP port number to send request(s) to.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.RequestRecursion
member.summary: Request that the DNS server performs recursion.

remarks.para: Default value: true
Sets (true) or clears (false) the "RD" (Recursion Desired) flag in the request sent to DNS servers.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.UseEdns0
member.summary: Include EDNS0 option in request.

remarks.para: Default value: true
Primarily used to enable reponse packets larger than 512 bytes over UDP for efficiency.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.Edns0Payload
member.summary: Informs the DNS server about the maximum response size (in bytes) that can be accepted over UDP.

remarks.para: Default value: 1280
Only used when is true.
Must be in the range 512 to 65535.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.RetryCount
member.summary: The number of times each DNS request should be resent if the DNS server does not respond with the period.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.TimeOut
member.summary: The time to wait for a response from a server before resending request or timing out.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions.Use0x20
member.summary: Use "DNS0x20" to protect against DNS spoofing.

remarks.para: Default value: false

When enabled, the letter casing in the domain name requested from the DNS server will be randomized and matched to response. This improves transaction identity and thereby makes DNS spoofing harder - for details see http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-vixie-dnsext-dns0x20-00

note.para: This option is not enabled by default because it does not work with all older DNS servers.

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.RequestOptions
member.summary: Represents various options for a DNS request.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.FromServer
member.summary: The IP address of the DNS server from which this was received.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.RecursionAvailable
member.summary: Response "RA" flag.
member.remarks: Indicates if server is willing to perform recursion.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.AuthoritativeAnswer
member.summary: Response "AA" flag.
member.remarks:
If true, this server () is hosting the DNS zone that the requested domain name belongs to.
If false, the response was obtained (through recursion) from another DNS server.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.AnswerRecords
member.summary: DNS records in the Answer section of the response.
member.remarks:
A DNS response contains 3 sections, each containing a number of DNS records:
1) The Answer section contains records corresponding to the requested domain name and type.
2) The Authority section may contain a SOA-record indicating which DNS zone the requested domain name belongs to, and/or NS-records indicating the DNS servers responsible for the requested domain name.
3) The Additional section contains any records which the DNS server thought might help the client - for example host (A) records matching the host names pointed to by MX-records in the Answer section.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.AuthorityRecords
member.summary: DNS records in the Authority section of the response.
member.remarks:
A DNS response contains 3 sections, each containing a number of DNS records:
1) The Answer section contains records corresponding to the requested domain name and type.
2) The Authority section may contain a SOA-record indicating which DNS zone the requested domain name belongs to, and/or NS-records indicating the DNS servers responsible for the requested domain name.
3) The Additional section contains any records which the DNS server thought might help the client - for example host (A) records matching the host names pointed to by MX-records in the Answer section.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.AdditionalRecords
member.summary: DNS records in the Additional section of the response.
member.remarks:
A DNS response contains 3 sections, each containing a number of DNS records:
1) The Answer section contains records corresponding to the requested domain name and type.
2) The Authority section may contain a SOA-record indicating which DNS zone the requested domain name belongs to, and/or NS-records indicating the DNS servers responsible for the requested domain name.
3) The Additional section contains any records which the DNS server thought might help the client - for example host (A) records matching the host names pointed to by MX-records in the Answer section.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.HasEdns0
member.summary: Indicates if an EDNS0 option is included in the response.
member.remarks: This is primarily used to indicate that the server accepts request packets larger than 512 bytes over UDP for efficiency.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.Edns0PayLoad
member.summary: Indicates the maximum request size (in bytes) that the server can be accept over UDP.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.Record.Name
member.summary: The domain name of this DNS record.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.Record.Type
member.summary: The DNS record type

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.Record.TTL
member.summary: The maximum time that this record may be cached (Time To Live).

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.Response.Record.Data
member.summary: The record data in master file format (RFC1035 section 5).

member.summary: Represents a DNS record received from a DNS server.

member.summary: Represents a response received from a DNS server

member.remarks: Servers are in the same order as they were queried.

member.summary: If is this contains the Exception caused by a Socket method. Otherwise null/Nothing.

member.summary: IP address of the DNS server.

member.summary: Type of problem ecountered.

member.name: P:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ServerProblem.ProblemDescription
member.summary: Description of problem.

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ServerProblem
member.summary: Represents a DNS server and how/why it failed to return a definitive answer.

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.RCode1FormErr
member.summary: Server returned RCode 1 - Format Error

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.RCode2ServFail
member.summary: Server returned RCode 2 - Server Failure

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.RCode4NotImp
member.summary: Server returned RCode 4 - Not Implemented

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.RCode5Refused
member.summary: Server returned RCode 5 - Refused

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.RCodeOther
member.summary: Server return an unsupported RCode

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.TimeOut
member.summary: Request timed out

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.ParseError
member.summary: Error parsing resonse from server

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.NoQNameInResponse
member.summary: No QName in response from server

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.QNameMisMatch
member.summary: QName in response from server does not match sent request

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.NoAnswer
member.summary: Response contained no answer

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.IPUnreachable
member.summary: Server IP address is not reachable (ICMP unreachable)

member.name: F:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType.SocketException
member.summary: Socket method caused exception. See property for details

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException.ProblemType
member.summary: Enumeration of reasons how/why a DNS server failed to return a definitive answer.

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDefinitiveAnswerException
member.summary: None of the DNS servers returned a definitive answer. See the property for individual DNS server problems.

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NXDomainException
member.summary: The requested domain name does not exist (DNS server returned RCode 3 NXDomain).

member.name: T:JHSoftware.DnsClient.NoDataException
member.summary: The requested domain name exists but has no records of the requested type.
member.remarks: The DNS server returned a "No Data" response - no answer records and a matching SOA-record in the Authority section.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.DnsClient.IdnEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Punycodes a domain name.
member.param: The domain name (in native form) to be encoded.

remarks.para: Labels (segment between dots in domain name) that contains non-english characters will by puny-encoded. Resulting labels will begin with 'xn--' followed by encoded characters.
For more information about IDNs (Internationalized Domain Names) see KB1032.

member.name: M:JHSoftware.DnsClient.IdnDecode(System.String)
member.summary: De-punycodes a domain name.
member.param: The domain name (in encoded form) to be decoded.

remarks.para: Encoded labels (segment between dots in domain name) starting with 'xn--' will be de-coded to the original non-english characters.
For more information about IDNs (Internationalized Domain Names) see KB1032.

member.summary: Class containing static methods for various DNS client functions as well as supporting classes and enumerations.
